result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael S Streicher was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 255 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision and from prison wages.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Brookfield Police Dept. Transcript Fee to be forwarded to the District Attorney's office. Cash bail applied to costs, Paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.
Victim Impact Panel meeting was already completed.

Case 17CF0820 was dismissed and read in.
No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

10:59 AM Defendant Michael S Streicher in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Bailey advises that the parties have resolved the matter and the 7/9/19 jury trial can be removed from the calendar.  State presents the offer.  Atty. Bailey confirms the offer as placed on the record.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Atty. Nickolie would like to present the defendant's driving record for purposes of sentencing.  No objection by Atty. Bailey.  Court will accept the driving record for the purposes of sentencing.  Court continues with the plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.  Court also orders case 17CF820 dismissed and read into this case.  State presents their recommendations for sentencing.  Atty. Bailey presents his recommendations for sentencing.  Defendant presents statements.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

7 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 255 days):
  -  4 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling as recommended by the Agent.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel - Already completed.
No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (Court to apply the cash bail on deposit in this case & 17CF820; remainder to be paid from prison wages and/or as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to Town of Brookfield Police Department);

FINE:  $2912.00 (Court to apply the cash bail on deposit in this case & 17CF820; remainder to be paid from prison wages and/or as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (Court to apply the cash bail on deposit in this case & 17CF820; remainder to be paid from prison wages and/or as a condition of extended supervision)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $10.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney (Court to apply the cash bail on deposit in this case & 17CF820; remainder to be paid from prison wages and/or as a condition of extended supervision).

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Court's response letter to defendant.
Certificates earned by the defendant
Letter from attorney Bailey regarding certificates earned by the defendant.

11:28 AM Defendant Michael S Streicher in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Debbie Price, with Corporation Counsel, in court on behalf of Waukesha County and Waukehsa County Sheriff's Dept.  Case called for hearing to address Atty. Price's objection to defendant's second request to allow defendant a guarded visit with his mother.  Court reviews minutes and findings from the 5/14/2019 motion hearing on the record.  Atty. Price confirms her objection to the second request and presents statements.  Atty. Price advises she has representatives from the Jail and the Sheriff's Dept. who can testify with regards to her objections.  Atty. Bailey has no objection to informal questioning of the representatives.  Atty. Price calls Capt. Angela Wollenhaupt.  Capt. Wollenhaupt questioned by Atty. Price.  Court questions Capt. Wollenhaupt.  Atty. Bailey questions Capt. Wollenhaupt.  Atty. Price calls Capt. Neil Dussault.  Capt. Dussault questioned by Atty. Price.  Atty. Bailey questions Capt. Dussault.  Court presents a question to Atty. Bailey and Mr. Streicher.  Atty. Price presents final statements.  Atty. Nickolie renews the State's objection and presents statements.  Atty. Bailey presents statements.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the defendant's second request for a visit with his mother.  Court will order that defendant be allowed 1 hour phone call with his mother and court will waive the costs for that 1 phone call; the call is to occur in the next 7 days.
Motion hearing on May 29, 2019 at 11:30 am.
Amended Witness List filed by the plaintiff.

09:31 AM Defendant Michael S Streicher in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for hearing on defendant's motion to modify bail.  Court also notes it has received Defendant's motion in limine and letters from the defendant.  Court first questions counsel with regards to when we can address defendant's motion in limine.  Atty. Bailey is comforable with addressing them at the jury status date.  Atty. Nickolie is in agreement with that.  Court will address the motions in limine at the 6/27/19 Jury status hearing.  Court will proceed with argument on defendant's motion to modify bail.  Atty. Nickolie objects to any modification and presents statements.  Atty. Bailey presents statements.  Defendant presents statements.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will allow 1 more visit with the defendant's mother and will follow the same order as the last time.  Court will order that the funds be removed from the defendant's bail on deposit.  All previously set court dates will remain as set.  Case recalled at 10:05 AM; Atty. Chris Bailey appears on behalf of his defendant.  Atty. Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that Atty. Bailey waived the appearance of his client.  Atty. Bailey advises that as Corporation Counsel was not advised of the hearing today they need time to review the request and advise whether or not they approve of the request.  Atty. Bailey does not feel another hearing date is needed but is asking the court to hold off on signing an order until he hears back from Atty. Price.  Court will hold off on signing the order with regards to defendant's visit with his mother and will have Atty. Bailey provide the court with a letter advising if Corporation Counsel approves of the request or if the matter needs to be set by hearing with in the next 2 weeks.

02:33 PM Defendant Michael S Streicher in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for hearing on motion for bail review and to address recent letter filed by the defendant.  Atty. Bailey presents statements.  State advises they will be objecting to any bail modification.  Atty. Bailey presents arguments to the court. 09:41 AM Defendant Michael S Streicher in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Harris advises the court of the status of the case and that the defendant has a few questions for the court.  Court takes a recess at 9:43 to allow time for counsel to discuss the matter with his client.  Case recalled at 9:57 AM; all appearances remain the same.  Atty. Harris advises the court of the status of the case.  Court does note that the State did send in a request to reschedule the jury trial which was granted.  Defendant presents statements.  Court addresses the defendant.  Defendant presents additional statements.  Atty. Harris moves to withdraw as counsel.  No objection from the State.  Court grants Atty. 09:51 AM Defendant Michael S Streicher in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that it has received and reviewed multiple letters from the defendant regarding a request to be released to see his mother as well as noting a speedy trial demand.  Atty. Harris advises the court of the status of the case as well as presents statements with regards to the letters filed by the defendant.  Atty. Harris is requesting the matter be set for plea and sentencing and is asking the court reconsider the defendant's request to modify bail and allow the defendant release to visit his mother.  Atty. Nickolie still objects to the request to modify bail and presents additional statements.  Atty. Nickolie is requesting the court set the matter for trial based on the defendant's speedy trial demand.  Court will first address defendant's speedy trial demand.  Defendant presents statements and discusses the issue with his attorney off the record.  After discussing the matter with his attorney the defendant advises the court he is withdrawing his speedy trial demand.  Court will allow the speedy trial demand withdrawn.  Court will next address scheduling.  Atty. Nickolie is requesting the matter be placed on the trial calendar.  Atty. Harris objects and is requesting the matter just be set for plea and sentencing in about 30 days.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing in about 30 days but will also set a jury trial date.  Court will next address defendant's request for release to visit his mother.  Atty. Nickolie objects and presents statements.  Court will not allow defendant release to visit his mother at this time but will allow Atty. Harris bring the matter back before the court if he provides proof.  Court will also deny defendant's motion for reconsideration to modify bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2019 at 09:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 14, 2019 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 26, 2019 at 08:15 am.

02:30 PM Defendant Michael S Streicher in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for continued hearing on defendant's motion to modify bail.  Atty. Harris presents statements.  Court also notes that is has received and reviewed the correspondence from the defendant filed on 12/7/2018.  Atty. Harris presents arguments.  Court reviews the status of the case on the record.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Harris presents additional statements and is asking the bail be reduced.  State objects and presents arguments.  Atty. Harris responds.  Court addresses counsel and despite the court's decision with regards to the bail motion the court would like to schedule the matter for trial today.  Atty. Harris responds and based on the circumstances is requesting the matter be set for further proceedings and will be in a better place to address setting a trial date at that time.  For reasons placed on the record the Court denies the motion to modify bail.  Atty. Harris presents additional statements and advises that the defendant can come up with some additional funds with regards to bail.  Court previous ruling denying motion to modify bail will remain.  Bail remains as fixed.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in early January.  Defendant presents questions to the court; responses made by the court and counsel.  Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2019 at 09:00 am.

Motion hearing on December 21, 2018 at 08:30 am.

08:33 AM Defendant Michael S Streicher in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Harris advises the court of the status of the case and that he was appointed throught he PD's office to represent the defendant in this matter.  Atty. Harris advises that the defendant would like to make a statement with regards to his missed court appeareance and he would also like to address bail today.  Court also notes that the defendant has filed multiple letters which the court can address today.  Atty. Harris presents statements.  Court reviews the current bail in this matter.  Atty. Harris presents additional statements and is moving to have bail modified.  State objects to any bail modification and presents statements.  Atty. Harris responds.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Harris presents additional statements.  State presents additional statements.  Court has questions about where the case is going at this time.  Atty. Harris advises that as he was just appointed he needs additional time to review the files and an offer to figure out where the case is headed.  At this time Court will deny the motion to modify bail, but will adjourn the matter for further proceedings before the end of the year and will allow the bail motion to be readdressed at that time.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 21, 2018 at 08:30 am.
